author: xtqqczze
body:
_All changes have been merged._

Follow-up to #12916

* <strike>Autofix [RCS1036](https://github.com/JosefPihrt/Roslynator/blob/master/docs/analyzers/RCS1036.md): Remove redundant empty line</strike> <ins>changes split to #13404</ins>
* <strike>Autofix [RCS1033](https://github.com/JosefPihrt/Roslynator/blob/master/docs/analyzers/RCS1033.md): Remove redundant boolean literal</strike> <ins>changes split to #13454, #13994</ins>
* <strike>Autofix [RCS1114](https://github.com/JosefPihrt/Roslynator/blob/master/docs/analyzers/RCS1114.md): Remove redundant delegate creation</strike> <ins>changes merged in #13441</ins>

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: rebased to restart CI

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Marked for maintainer review because of large line changes.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
I'm leaving the review-maintainer tag, so the maintainers can review what was done here and see if we should update the contribution guide.

One suggestion, is that guidance should be:

- limit PR size
- Fix One issue per PR


Although it is guidance, the guidance is a consideration during PR review.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> limit PR size

It seems we already have this recommendation. Also for automatic fixes (by script or analyzer) it is better to fix all code base at a time.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
> It seems we already have this recommendation. Also, for automatic fixes (by script or analyzer) it is better to fix all code base at a time.

Then, I'm at a deadlock.  Large fixes are not reasonably reviewable.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: OK, I will seperate RCS1114: Remove redundant delegate creation changes into new PR, so that they can be reviewed and merged. I will not rebase this PR, leaving @iSazonov approval intact. This means we will have to merge in order.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> Then, I'm at a deadlock. Large fixes are not reasonably reviewable.

We have already gained some experience in the area:
- do only one kind of a change per PR
- combine  changes in some small commits and review by commit.
- pull PRs per module/project, for SMA - per subsystem.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: @iSazonov @TravisEz13 I have split some changes from `RCS1033: Remove redundant boolean literal` to #13454 based upon project.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@PowerShell/powershell-maintainers reviewed this PR and agreed to accept it for 7.2-preivew. So we should delay merging it until after 7.1-RC1 release branch gets created.
> The changes make sense and the chance of confliction is relatively low, but it requires line-by-line review to make sure there is no potential incorrect change, so it's better to delay merging it till 7.2 preview to avoid possible regression.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Set Draft till 7.2 Preview1.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @xtqqczze Please resolve merge conflicts.

comments.author: iSazonov

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: @iSazonov I'm minded to close this in favour of #13994, which should include all of these changes. This PR has been open for many months, I think a fresh start would be easier to review.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: all changes are merged, closed

title: Code redundancy fixes pass 2
